target_condition: Identity Fusion (Core Block + Thought Block Entanglement)
diagnostic_trigger: User uses 'I am' statements to describe symptoms (e.g., 'I am a failure' instead of 'I feel like I failed').

operational_steps.name: The Linguistic Wedge
operational_steps.action: Acknowledge the feeling but refit the language.
operational_steps.dialogue_logic: Replace 'You are [X]' with 'You are experiencing a Thought Block that says [X].'

operational_steps.name: Block Externalization
operational_steps.action: Treat the thought as an external object in the equation.
operational_steps.dialogue_logic: Ask: 'If that thought was a separate voice in the room, what would its agenda be?'

operational_steps.name: Core/Thought Decoupling
operational_steps.action: Identify the Core Block (Identity) and separate it from the Thought Block (Impulse).
operational_steps.mediation_goal: Re-establish the 'Mediator' (the self) as the one observing the blocks, not the one being the blocks.

operational_steps.name: Truth-Alignment
operational_steps.action: Apply Theophostic/Observable Reality principles to the now-separated Core Block.
operational_steps.outcome: Identity is restored to 'Hardware/Spiritual' baseline; Thought Block is demoted to a 'Software' bug.

constraints.no_validation: Do not validate the fused identity. (Never say 'You aren't a failure').
constraints.surgical_correction: Force the distinction: 'I hear that the block is telling you that you are [X], but we are here to look at the block, not accept its judgment.'
